title: How to Sharpen a Knife Without Tools

steps.headline: Find a piece of stone of convenient size and shape.
steps.description: any variety will do, even a piece of cement.

steps.headline: Scrape most of the rust off the blade, especially along the cutting edge.
Keep scraping diagonally toward and across the cutting edge, alternating sides from time to time.
Try "lubricating" this process with a little water.
A tiny steel "feather" will form along the edge as it grows sharper.
steps.description: Remove this feather by drawing the cutting edge through a piece of wood.

steps.headline: When you are satisfied that you can get the blade no sharper with your stone,  whet the blade further by drawing it diagonally across a leather shoe sole.
Within a few minutes have a usable cutting instrument.

text: Find a piece of stone of convenient size and shape. any variety will do, even a piece of cement. Scrape most of the rust off the blade, especially along the cutting edge.  Keep scraping diagonally toward and across the cutting edge, alternating sides from time to time.  Try "lubricating" this process with a little water.  A tiny steel "feather" will form along the edge as it grows sharper. Remove this feather by drawing the cutting edge through a piece of wood. When you are satisfied that you can get the blade no sharper with your stone,  whet the blade further by drawing it diagonally across a leather shoe sole.  Within a few minutes have a usable cutting instrument.  Finished.
